intro: Dimeria ornithopoda var. tenera, commonly known as the silky dimeria, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and adaptations to arid environments. The plant features dense, woolly foliage that helps reduce water loss and protect against intense sunlight. Its flowers are typically small and star-shaped, appearing in clusters during the warmer months. This variety is prized for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained, sandy soils.
